author: Shoumojit Banerjee
text:
The row over Shripal Sabnis’s remarks against Prime Minister Narendra Modi has taken an ominous turn with both the ruling BJP and Sanatan Sanstha, a right-wing outfit, demanding that the Marathi author issue a public aplogy.

The Pimpri-Chinchwad unit of the BJP on Thursday lodged a complaint with the Pune police against Dr. Sabnis accusing him of attempting to “tarnish” Mr. Modi’s reputation.

At a function in Pimpri-Chinchwad last week, Dr. Sabnis, president of the upcoming 89th Akhil Bharatiya Marathi Sahitya Sammelan, 2016, had criticised Mr. Modi as a man forever “smeared with the taint of the 2002 Gujarat riots”. “We will not let him [Dr. Sabnis] take the podium at the Sahitya Sammelan unless he issues a public apology,” BJP MP Amar Sable told The Hindu .
title: BJP files complaint against Marathi author Sabnis
